image_analysis.description: Return a brief summary of what you can see on the image, listing all formatting elements and visible text. Identify the position of page number(s).

transcription.description:
- Task: Return a precise transcription of the provided Swiss address book page according to the instructions in this field.
- Context: You are transcribing pages from Swiss address books published between 1860 and 1980 for the cities of Zurich, Basel and Bern. These documents may contain names, residential listings, municipal records, professional directories, or related civic content.
- Scope â€” include everything: Transcribe **all** visible text exactly as it appears: names, addresses, occupations, headers, footers, page numbers, annotations, etc.
- Multi-column text: If the page has multiple columns, **transcribe column by column**.
- Diacritics: **Preserve all original diacritics** exactly as they appear.
- Historical orthography: Maintain original spelling conventions, archaic terminology, and non-standard abbreviations.
- Multilingual entries: Some entries may contain German, French, or Italian text. Transcribe all languages verbatim.
- Page numbers: Write page numbers appearing on headers and footers like this example: `<page_number>9<page_number>`.
- Output format: Provide **only** the transcription. If and only if no transcribable text is found on the image set this field to null.
- No fabrication: **Do not hallucinate.** Keep spelling, punctuation, and wording **verbatim**, even if they appear unusual or archaic.

no_transcribable_text.description: True if the image contains no transcribable text; otherwise, false.

transcription_not_possible.description: True *if and only if* transcription is entirely impossible; otherwise, false.
